title: Güell Tapas Restaurant
address: Carrer Nou de la Rambla, 20, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
description: Simple tavern for Catalan tapas & wine. Simple regional tapas & sharing platters like fideua noodles, plus Catalan wines, at a wooden bar.

reviews_data.snippet: I’ve been at this restaurant twice and I got both times great experiences. The place is friendly and the food is great. Here you have a real spanish food experience. The paellas are delicious, the fish is fresh and juicy, and the meat is well made. The tapas are good as well as the dessert. I highly recommend it.

Excellent venue where we enjoyed a lunch meal inside the restaurant. Staff were nice and helped with recommendations for tapas. Sangria was good and the paella was almost too much for our party to finish, but very delicious. Recommend if in the area.

Awesome tiny restaurant in a central location of Barcelona!They have some delicious dishes, friendly staff, and an excellent anti-covid organization. Waiting time wasn’t bad, anywhere from 10-40 minutes seems right. You can sit and have a drink while you wait which was a plus 🍷I would highlight our seafood platter, which was amazing! Paella was really good too!If you are getting a paella, waiting time is around 30 minutes so I would recommend getting some tapas and wine while you wait.We would def. go back!

It was the best food I’ve ever had in Barcelona. I visited Guell Tapas on the first day of my trip but I couldn’t find any restaurant better than here. The seafood paella has really deep and rich flavor and I can’t stop thinking of it 👍👍👍 Super highly recommended!!!
One of the best places to eat in Barcelona. Reasonable prices, friendly people and tasteful food. Will visit it again
We were 2 times in 4 days in Guell Tapas. The food is amazing especially Paella. We also order Tapas and it was also good.The staff is great and they speak English. We recommended Sangria for drink.

Visited this place based on the google reviews… nice ambiance, good service and good options on the menu. Starters (croquettes and tomato bread) was nice. Paella for mains was very disappointing - it was a bit over cooked and tasteless..

Even if we started on The wrong foot , in the end i can definitely recommend this restaurant.I visited for lunch with my girlfriend.They didn’t have a table inside for us so we stayed on the terrace where there were 3 drunk guys who were very loud.Fortunately , they left before the food came and after that everything was perfect.For starters we order 3 tapas which were very tasty , i recommend the sausages.We got seafood paella as main , big portion and very tasty.It was all followed by a savory catalan cream which was also very good

That's one of the best places to eat I have ever tried! Unbelievable delicious dishes, kind and responsive staff, excellent anti-covid organization. Usually waiting time for free table is 15-40 minutes, but there are tables for waiting people, where you can enjoy Estrella Damm or other drink while waiting.Price isn't low in any means, but it deserves every cent spent!Overall 5 of 5 experience and I definitely recommend Guell Tapas.
Tasty food and great atmosphere! Highly recommended! :)In the pictures you can see paella’s ( seafood and chicken ), spaghetti and octopus:)

What an awesome dining experience!!! We got the chicken croquettes to start and the seafood paella- all of it was prepared perfectly and deliciously. The seafood paella was amazing- all the seafood in it was incredibly tender 😩 the chicken croquettes were crispy and the interior was so creamy. You won’t regret a visit here!

Wonderful atmosphere for locals as for tourists. We went there twice on our holiday and it was delicious both times. The waiter forgot one tapas order once but his friendliness and helpfulness made up for it times 10!!!I would recommend you order the chicken stripes with curry mayo from the tapas menu. It was each ones favourite.

After having 2 shared desserts for breakfast, we left to do a bus tour to see more of the town. By 5-ish I really needed to eat. We found Guell and were very pleased. It's got a very cute look that was immediately welcoming. In fact, I stopped to take pictures on the way in. We had the sautéed calamari, home-made meatballs, arugula salad with shaved parmesan, and ham croquettes. A side of bread came first with the requisite EVOO. All was very good, though my wife and I had widely differing opinions on the meatballs. I didn't like them but she did. Service was good. My Spanish is so-so, but I make do. Staff was friendly and accommodating. And, we made friends on both sides of us. Worth a repeat.

Beautiful location, amazing food smell inside, very good quality food and taste. Foget about pricey boqueria: here you can eat traditional and tasteful tapas and paellas at the right price. Highly recommend, you won't complain.
Super friendly, fast, super yummy 🤤 Best food so far in Barcelona.
Very delicious food and kind staff. Totally recommended. You should try chicken croquettes, tortilla de patatas and sangria.

Stayed 3 nights in Barcelona in October 21 and ate here twice it was so good. Really enjoyed the tapas with good recommendations from the waiters and a fab Sangria with cava the perfect accompaniment. The staff all work really hard but have a great attitude and nothing is too much trouble. Definitely worth a visit.
Amazing experience, service and food!Thank you for the great delicious taste.

Very very good food ( fresh ) and great atmosphere with nice staff. If you haven’t booked, be ready to wait a little bit outside but it’s worthy trust me. We even book another table for Sunday night to try the paella this time🥘Update : we have been there for the paella they were great and Gerson was amazing with us ! Thank you for being so happy and helpful around us Gerson we appreciate it 🌈
Amazing restaurant - good food and very polite and professional stuff. Garden inside is perfect balance - sky above you, without traffic and noise, nice atmosphere and interior. Strongly recommend!
Very tasty patatas bravas, nice paella, delicious goat cheese tapas
We went with my girlfriend yesterday and shared 5 tapas. Everything was delicious, the sangria cava we can highly recommend. Ferrero cake were very good. Great service and very friendly staff!

It’s ok I guess, the tapas were good but definitely the seafood paella was the worst I ever had and I had tried so many paellas in different cities, Valencia, Sevilla, and others.I am really disappointed in this place, it has such good reviews that is why I decided to go but I have no idea why the good reviews; with the horrible paella they have, the rice wasn’t cooked all the way, too salty, the taste was just not good. The red wine Sangria good size but was flavorless 😣☹️
Best paella I've ever eaten! 😍The desert is so delicious, I alsmost had a mouthgasm!
Very friendly and comfy place. We visited it in our last night and it was the best place to say goodbye to Barcelona. Gerson was perfect waiterHighly recommended!
Very easy going but charming restaurant for tapas. Sangria was as expected, tapas exceeded.
You must visit this restaurant. Bery good paella and the best patatas bravas. All fresh and very tasty !
Excellent service, very tasty dishes, nice ambience. Bravo!
Awesome and authentic tapas restaurant. Reasonably priced, the food is delicious and portions are good size.
Had some tapas and paella with ribs and mushrooms. Heavenly!Staff was very pleasant and spoke good english. Also, they did let us try our not perfect spanish! Overall a very nice experience!

This is the best restaurant I had in Barcelona, the food, price and service. The beef is tasty and juicy, the fry baby squids is crispy outside and tender inside, the chicken is crunchy, the salad and drink is good too. I would highly recommend this restaurant. Two thumbs up!!

I enjoyed it very much. The food was really good. The atmosphere was cozy. All the employees that I encountered were very nice. One recommendation though. MAKE RESERVATIONS! I was a walk in and waited about 30 minutes, but they were telling others who came in after me it would be an hour or more. Seems to be a very popular place. The food speaks for itself.
Excellent place! Had a very good vegetarian Paella. Very good ambience.
Best paella I had in Barcelona.
The staffs are very caring, the tapas and desert are perfect but the Fideua didn't gives me the wow effect as I expected from reading the reviews.

Excellent food, kind service and great location. The prices come a bit higher, but are compensated by the wonderful taste of everything. Great place to try authentic paella and sea food. If there was a bigger star grade I would gladly give it.
Delicious paella. Amazing sangria. Solid tapas restaurant!
I came here due to the excellent reviews the food received and couldn’t help but be a bit disappointed. The tapas were nice, but the paella was dry. The ambience and service was nice though.

Just ate at Guell Tapas Restaurant and cannot fault anything. Really tasty and great value for money aside, the staff couldn’t do enough to make sure we were taken care of (my daughter has a gluten intolerance). Highly recommended and we will definitely return. Excellent.
Nice atmosphere and very good calamari tapas but sea food paella was disappointing (rise wasn’t balanced cooked and I missed the taste, plus Color looked a bit boring)…

Good people, delicious tapas but little expensive. I ordered en tapas with anchovy and en tapas with cube meat( I don't remember names)both were perfect. Desert crema catalan og some lemon cake , 1 star of 3 star.

I have to give it 5stars..veal fillet was perfect as was the red House wine..partners paella was a disappointment..as have all the other paellas in Barca...maybe the English do it better!! They offered her a free dessert. Top place.. don't be put off by the outside..we were taken down to the back..where it's best..fab evening here..very reasonable too.
The food is great. We tried several tapas and it was the best experience. The service is fast and they make you feel welcome. Great music, such a warming place. Visit and enjoy!
It’s really local and good stuff who is serving it’s annoyed that we didn’t find a spot inside the last corner and in the walking area there was some tables it’s good but not the best spot
Price and portion is okay. Thou I can tell the seafoods aren't fresh :/
Amazing place to have a great time. Big portions and a very nice ambiance. We were sitting close to the kitchen and could see the chefs in action. Very impressive. Absolutely worth a visit.
Best Paella in Barcelona !! Great Service nice place. Gladly again & again

Service was great, however some of the dishes had let us down. We were given freezing cold meatballs which were then taken away to be reheated and you could tell they were frozen. The tomato bread, Patatas and garlic mayo and steak strips were amazing. We then had the paella which the chicken was dry as a bone but the rest of it was lovely.Such a shame as the staff were lovely and the service was good

Absolutely delicious!!! We will come here again and again. And again! Very friendly waiters, great atmosphere, delicious tapas and paellas, and the Sangria is a must try (with lots of fruit!) We enjoyed every single bite!!!

Very nice chilled out place for tapas. Good service and tasty food. I’ll be honest and say the olives aren’t the best I’ve ever tasted but I have had a lot of olives in my life so it doesn’t take away from the fact it’s still nice.
A decent paella 🥘 and very nice staff.
Very good place i always come hare. The Staff are really friendly and service is really good. One of the best place ❤️

Great staff really fun, we tried pretty much everything. We do recommend it ! If you want a real taste of Spain you need to try the typical dishes which are done perfectly ! Such as bravas, the ham...We really recommend it !

We visited three evenings in a row! Usually you have to wait for a table here, but the wait is totally worthy! They have wonderful tapas, beer, entrecot, paella, seafood and desserts. The staff are very nice, and the food is more than tasty! Totally recommended!!!
Just a fantastic evening, service and food. I highly recommend stopping in here for a dinner or three! I will be back.

Super delicious... wish I was there right now eating the patatas bravas! The staff are very friendly and welcoming and even looked after us with a complimentary drink which was lovely. The food is to die for, you will not be disappointed. The couple who sat next to us said the paella was the nicest they've ever had. The location is also perfect so if you are around definitely pop in and give it a go.

Very good food. Kind and skilled employees. Very good price. Nice ambience. Overall a very good experience. We ordered the tapas, paella and ferrero rocher cake with sangria cave and everything was excellent. Highly recommended restaurant!

I highly recommend the restaurant for Sangria (best Sangria in all of Barcelona). Not recommended for Paella the frozen one is better and cheaper. you should expect a long queue or you should reserve in the unfound reservation site.
Amazing place for tapas, lovely ambiance, great staff. 100% recommended.
Best tapas restaurant I have ever been. Food is very delicious (over my stay in Bercelona I tried almost everything from their menu) and I will come back again!
Best calamari I’ve ever had! One of my favorite spots in Barcelona after my great experience there. Great atmosphere, friendly service. I will be back!

Wildly variable dishes led to wildly different outcomes. There are several dozen tapas dishes to choose from, and many of them are commonly found in nearby tapas restaurants.The good: Iberian ham croquettes, anchovies, calamaris, potatoes with garlic sauce, beef, goat cheese with veggies, cappuccino.The mediocre: meatballs were blah, seafood paella.Even the saltiness of each dish was unpredictable. On some dishes like the calamari, I had to sprinkle salt to get the added saltiness.The overall quality of the dishes were good, so I was willing to overlook the imperfections.
The best paella We’ve ever had!
I love this resturent...food is very testy..and delicious.. Service man very frankly 💖💖
Fresh bread was great. Seafood soup was good anchovy bread ok, but not enough anchovy. Nice atmosphere.

Amazing, couldn’t recommend more highly, the food was amazing, the staff were all lovely and super attentive, great value for money and they even indulged us on our request for cocktails. Will be recommending to anyone who is visiting barcelona!

Decent Mediterranean spread. Reasonably priced. Staffs were warm and welcoming. Paella tasted great. Cava sangria tasted more like orange juice. Portion is big, good for group sharing. Carbonara was way too cheesy tho. Seafood were very fresh.
This place was amazing! The food and service were spectacular. The staff were so kind and helpful, and the paella de pollo was delicious. Thank you Güell!

Absolutely phenomenal meal every time I've been here. Traditional Spanish tapas and dishes, as well as amazing paella. Awesome sangria too! The back part of the restaurant is super cozy! The prices are fair and service is good. I deff recommend!
Great place! Tasty food and nice service

I’d give this place 10 stars if I could! The service is exceptional and atmosphere beautiful! We particularly enjoyed their courtyard which is stunning.We had our first of many Paella here during our stay in Barcelona and this was by far our very favorite. So much so, we went back!Their cava sangria is exceptional as were their garlic shrimp tapas. Everything was just amazing!! Go here, you wont be disappointed!
Visited this place three times and had an amazing experience. Friendly people, very good food and a really cozy place. Favorite dish was Croquetas de Pollo.
A friend of mine recommended to me this tapas bar and i was satisfied. Super tasty food i had the seafood paella, and my girlfriend the lamb.Stuff super friendly and welcoming.
Beautiful place and amazing food. Probably you'd have to wait a little bit to be in a table but you can wait in the bar and have a drink. Order the patatas bravas. It was tasteful

Great paella and tapas. The best we had during our stay in Barcelona, just wish we had found this place sooner. The staff is friendly, and the food is prepared perfectly. There's not much else to say about it, if you want great Catalan food, this is the place to go.
Hidden restaurant for good paella. Food was tasty and drinks were nice. Like most places in Barcelona you have to stumble upon this place to find it. Paella was very good.
Very good food.

Probably one of the best tapas places in the Gothic Quarter that we tried! The service and taste was above and beyond as well. The menu is simple and the place is always packed. Try to get there around 10.30 or 11pm to avoid large crowds.
Great food and service, normally busy so reserve a table or go before 20 to not wait too much for table
I confirm that the restoration has the character and taste. Paella seafood, amazing taste.Care of us the waiter Sara from sicily - amazing girl
Nice tapas and best dessert I ever had! highly recommend
Great restaurant, tapas and paella were awesome here. Came here twice during our trip. Service was good too, even on a busy Saturday night the wait wasn't bad.
Fake paella.. don’t be fooled by other photos.. the rice is just basic rice boiled, look at the colour.. so basic is a disappointment..
Amazing paella and tapas. Be careful because we ordered so many tapas that we were afraid we wouldn’t have room for the paella!! Reasonable prices here. Staff is very friendly and attentive.
Fantastic food and delicious sangria. Interesting menu.
Nice tapas restaurant in the city centre.Good- nice interior- helpful staff- good food- parking garage nearby- price is reasonable

My husband and I came to this restaurant based on the great reviews on our first night in Catalonia. Gerson was our server and he gave us incredible recommendations for tapas, dessert and even introduced us orujo de hierbas (an herbal liquor from Galicia) which was perfect to help us digest our amazing tapas. The rest of the staff (Junior, Maria, David, Joel, Hector, and Francesc) were also so friendly and helpful. Would highly highly recommend.
Very good service which deserve High rate in google map.
Firstly, we did like the spanish looking interior also the waiter was very kind. We recommend paella de marisco, gaspacho and seafood soup. The quality and a taste of the food is extremely good.

Excellent restaurant! We have eaten so far the best tapas in Barcellona. We've been there twice and tasted different dishes. I can recommend Torrijas cake as a dessert! It's fantastic and good for two people. All staff are kind and have always accommodated our needs, even when we were lining up waiting for a table. Gerson, in particular, was a fantastic host: he gave us good hints and suggestions to have a real special meal. Actually he was the one suggesting the cake, and no choice was better than that: we wouldnt have ever picked it up just by the name. I recommend that place.

This restaurant was an amazing find . We tried the sangria, patata brava , meat balls tapas and Paella. Everything was amazing and filling for two of us. We loved the ambiance and the service . The waiters spoke English and took care of us really well. We would try and come back here during our 2 days visit in Barcelona!!
Lovely staff, fair priced for tourist area.
Food is so tasty, but the staff is not friendly. They just want you to leave.
Great food, great staff, friendly and helpful. Had a great paella, a tasty salad as starter, a good desert and a refreshing Sangria. Loved it. I truly recommend :)
Excellent typically spanish Food.Service was very good and every dish fantasic. Highly recommended!
The food was amazing, with their cute decoration and terrace, perfect place for lunch!
Nice location with great food. Prices were okay but service quite mediocre. I realise language barriers can be hard sometimes but some professionalism should be given.
Nice interior, good prices, paella was excellent. Staff very friendly. Would recommend

The night here was pretty good! We had 3 tapas, 1 paella, and 2 large sangrias and also a free shot at the end of our meal. All the tapas tasted great. This was my first paella so I have nothing to judge it too but the flavours were matched perfectly.
Amazing hospitality by gerson recommended the French toast it was amazing!! Tapas are great and paella is amazing!
delicious paella and tapas !
Mussels was perfect! Taste and cost♡♡The fried squid was also pretty nice.Sausage was so-so.When we get there at 12, we couldn't order main dishes because the kitchen was closing....

I’ve been there few times already, great place to eat a paella in the city center. As a person living in Barcelona for quite some time now, I am surprised to have this quality in turistic area. Gracias!

Rude and impatient waitress. Tapas were mediocre - greasy and tasteless. Valencia, San Sébastien or even nyc has better tapas than this place. Sangria has hardly any tasty of wine in it. I would rather call it a fruit juice.
The food is nice and quick, they are opened in the morning, a great option for breakfast
paella rice was slightly burnt. the calamari sauce was plain mayonnaise. nothing specially amazing here
Awesome food & service! Enjoyed a quiet and relaxing dinner.
Genuinely the best food ive ever tasted. The food was tender and was cooked perfectly, special mentions to the Paella..

We've been two consecutive days at Güell Tapas and tried a lot of the food and every dish was very delicious. Additionally, the staff working there was very friendly and the service was fast.Next time in Barcelona we'll definitely come back!
Quick and excellent staff and service! Aioli was extremely good!Value for your money, large portions/tapas!Close to Ramblas, really recommend a visit!
Nice paellas, good atmosphere:)
Magnificat food and service! Highly recomended for a dinner!
Amazing service and food. We loved it! Thank you guys 👏

Try the meatballs, the croquetas (any) and the arroz negro. They are just amazing. Delicious and highly recommended. All the food is fresh and the right traditional taste! All this served by a very friendly staff, very patient and happy to explain you all you need about the options in the menu, if you don't speak Spanish or Catalan very well.
Ok, touristy kind of place.Had the paella, some tapas and a sangaria.Average at best, would skip it...
Amazing place, delicious food and very tasty sangria 🇪🇸
The restaurant is in the centre of Barcelona, good quality of food, friendly staff to serve with smile. Good introduction to tourist. Must go and eat again.
Amazing restaurant, the tapas worth the price and portions are bigger than other places, try Sangria in that place!
An amazing hidden gem, away from the tourist traps
Nice place with good food and staff.
Best Paella & Seafood in Barcelona.

We came in and kindly asked if they had seats inside or outside and the barman seemed angry and refused to take us in because we had an one year old baby with us. He exactly said ‘we can take two people not three’. We asked ‘so no baby?’. He said ‘Yes!’. The place was empty. First rude experience in Barcelona.
Good Spanish food. Staff is attentive and service is good.
Great food , extremely worth itFriendly staff
Great tapas and paella, friendly service and lovely atmosphere !
Good food! We had some tapas, mixed paella, and a pitcher of sangria. The staff were all so friendly as well.
The best paella in Barcelona, lovely service and delicious deserts! If you're in Barcelona this place is must visit!

Tasty food at a reasonable price. The restaurant is just off the main Street and so avoids much of the tourist traffic. Would recommend it above the majority of similar restaurants nearbyThe staff were also polite and helpful, and the sangria was refreshing and tasty.
Best coffee in the area! We'll come back

The best tapas and food we had in Barcelona this time. Food-price ratio is excellent. We had potato omlet, catalan sausage, chicken croquet, and tomato bread and everything was soo yummy. We never met nicer staff anywhere else. This palce deserves more than 5 stars.
Delicious tapas - we came here twice in 4 days.
The most amazing food and the best service ever. A lost art these days!
Good Paella and Tapas in the city with reasonable price.
Cosy restaurant and bar. Tasty tapas - almost feels like gourmet food. Good wine and good service.
Great tapas all week. Cava sangria was great too.

Great tapas - we really enjoyed it.A great place - even for locals - that has very good tapas at a great price. Hard to select one favourite dish, since there were several different opinions. Overall, an enjoyable experience in the Ramblas, with a 20€ per person price tag, including drinks. A place to return.
Very good tapas and paella we really enjoy it . Very good value for money.

Excellent Food at Affordable PricingA group of us were in Barcelona for two nights and had a few subpar paellas until Guell Tapas. The prices here ranged around 15-25 EUR per pax for a meal. We ordered the Gazpacho, the Mixed Paella, Black Rice and a Catalan Creme Brulee. We were concerned whether we would be disappointed again with a restaurant located in a tourist district and menus in several languages available.Thankfully, it was good. The paella took a while but it was worth it, the rice was done right and flavourful. The seafood and meat had the right textures and was cooked beautifully.Before the paellas we also had a really nice Cava Sangria and a refreshing and savoury gazpacho to share.We completed the meal with a Catalan Cream Brulee which was also delicious, not too sweet and with the right texture. The good food and service was a memorable ending for our last night in Spain.
Very nice place and special thanks to all staff
Near the old town where is tourist area, easy to access. Food are good but a bit pricy. Paella was nice.

Highly recommended. The best tapas we have had in Barcelona! The portions are pretty big and also quite delicious. Both types of sangria were great. Additionally, it is quite cheap for what it offers. Great service as well.
Exellent service and the tapas were on point.

Amazing Tapas and the most delicious paella in Barcelona ... very friendly and amazing stuff thanks to Abed who managed our perfect dinner and the best chef in barcelona Ahmed.... thanks guys the best dinning experience in Barcelona
Very nice and good tapas!We also tried the paella, just so good :) one of the best i've tried so far .People and the service is very nice too.I warmly recommend the place!

Absolutely fantastic service. I ordered a seafood paella without the prawns. The waitress asked me if I was allergic to prawns to which I replied yes, and quickly proceeded to check with the chef. She returned to tell me that the paella is made with prawns as the base so she suggested a vegetable paella with seafood on top. I found this very considerate! The paella took 30 mins to arrive, which the waitress warned me about, but this just reassured me that the food was made fresh. The paella itself was very lovely. 100% recommend!

This food is so good here! We shared four different plates, which were all very good and authentic tasting. The sirloin steak was my favorite. The service was great. No long waits for anything and perfect recommendations. The sangría was amazing as well.
Server is so nice and pretty~Good service and good food!Must come!
Good food in the neighbourhood, not expensive and tasty! The home-made sauce for the patatas bravas is one of the better I had in Barcelona.

Great value on a very tasty mix paella! Lots of ordinary paella in Barcelona that is overpriced and bland. Good house wine! Get the bottle! Will definitely return. Looks very rustic and local. Staff is friendly and helpful!

Amazing seafood paella! We were very pleased finding a cosy restaurant at the center of La Rambla. Very friendly staff and great service! One of the best paellas we have tried. Highly recommend! We had a luck of sitting under the open sky at the middle of the restaurant ❤️Please visit, won’t be disappointed :) A cozy and airy smoking area too.

title: Five Guys
description: Fast-food burger & fries chain. Fast-food chain with made-to-order burgers, fries & hot dogs, plus free peanuts while you wait.

reviews_data.snippet: This is what passes as a grilled cheese sandwich. It tastes about the same as it looks and they charge 4.75€ for it. They should spend a little less time putting up posters about how great their food is and use that time to actually make this sandwich taste good.

If you ever had tasted it in the US, you're not gonna like it. It's nothing like there. Nevertheless, the concept of freshly made burgers and fries is still present, unlike the peanuts or the A1 sauce, which are not on the menu. Still, good-tasting burgers.

If you want McDonald’s burger (the simplest of them btw) at a price of a classy grill place, this is your place!So much hype over nothing. Seriously: I tried it out of curiosity ONLY because everybody were saying it was so great but… Excuse me?!Basically, everything was said in my first sentence, nothing to add here.Milk shake is acceptable tho. But just this: acceptable.
We had to wait for 40 minutes to get our fastfood today. Never had that long waiting period for such food. Other chains usually serve in 5-10 mins.

I've been wanting to try their burgers for years and finally got the chance.- Cheeseburger : You could tell everything was good quality but to me, the was burger bland. Ps: multitude of toppings to choose from.- Fries: Normal fries, quite good (again, quality, fresh not frozen), they also give free ketchup and mayo. Ps: small fries + the extra they put in the bag turns into a large portion.- Milkshake: Salted caramel. This was the best milkshake I have ever tasted!- Price: not cheap. Cheeseburger was 9.5, fries 3.75, Milkshake 5.75.Overall: Besides the heavenly millshake, I felt the food was fairly bland despite the fact that they use quality ingredients. Perhaps my expectations were too high from all the youtube videos I watched about them.
Great staff and nice atmosphere. The burger was good, but not great. The value for money is on the lower side!
Simple, fast and way more tasty than rest well known fast food restaurants
Very poor service, I took one hour waiting for my order, definitely not recommend
Good burgers, the place is a bit hectic and loud. Because of this, the guys didn't understand our orders well. Personally, I didn't like the fries, they were a bit too soft.

Food is great but the service has some room for improvement. The place was nearly empty, food for their own crew was made ahead of any customer. We had to wait 10 min for a shake. Too bad, nothing against 5 guys, but this one, does not stand the test.
Nicest hamburguer place in BCN
Not busy and slow with orders. Plus they didn’t even get my order right
Very popular food outlet food is amazing very friendly staff all ways try to help most of the speak English

It wasn't something I expected. Yes, you can put lots of toppings and have unlimited drinks but the quality is just terrible. It's cheap fast-food, nothing more. The meat reminded me McDonald's to be honest though not as horrible.The people who work there were very nice but food should be first.

I LOVE Five Guys! In my opinion the best fries in the world, and if you order cajun fries, even better. Besides that the hamburger is fresh and full of flavor! Before I discovered Five Guys I didn’t like fast food, it’s impossible to compare it with any other. And the milkshake is awesome as well. It’s impossible to go there and leave it without a big smile of full satisfaction.

I like the burger because it was heavy enough to fill me yet I could stand up after eating it. Also, the chips they serve you are real ones and nor frozen ones. Still, €16 for a burger is such a rip-off.
Five guys truly is gourmet fast food, can't recommend it enough. A bit pricy but totally worth it.
Peanutbutter Shake just the best. I wish they would bring back the Peanuts to snack during the waiting time to receive the burgers.
Best commercial burger so far.
Ok. But needs more of visual presentation of what one is buying. As it is now, all is uncertain.
Fast, loud and delicious. How 5 guys should be! Overly inflated prices for the location but we were hungry!
Great burger chain place.Nicely done!

excellent t fast food experience. despite being packed with travelers and tourists, there was virtually no wait, food was served quickly, and delicious. the burger and cajun fries tasted the same as the ones back home. the team was cleaning routinely to make sure the space felt orderly. the prices where fine as well. five guys for the win. I love mushrooms, grilled jalapenos, mayonaise on a cheeseburger.Traveler and Adventurer Influencer IG @brian.dent

Soo this was a huge disappointment. I have heard so much about Five guys on Reddit and have seen the lines for it in Madrid. So the burger is mehhh, it is not better than McD, actually it was worse because it was not salty at all and fried onion was barely fried so it was glassy and slimey. Fries were just ok. Considering that it comes up to 15 euros with drink it is craaaazy overpriced. The Good Burger place offers better burger for third of a price. Not to mention Bacoa which is even cheaper and completely out of this league and you get better beer than Budlight. Great location that's all, full of other American fast food places.

Waited about 20 min for a simple Hamburger + fries. Everything takes ages, to many options. You wait, standing, in a packed waiting zone. Everything is hectic. You'll find your food not on a tray, but thrown in a ghetto grocery bag, the fries where just thrown in.All free tables weren't cleaned and filthy. Toilet: dirty, no toilet paper, no soap.The food: the bun is too small for the two patties, it was soaked with sauces. The beef quality was okay, thick, juicy and a bit more than medium fried, but okay.Conclusion: too loud, too hectic, too much time needed, lot of garbage (aluminum, plastic,...), too expensive for average burgers.
Delicious food and a great location.

This is a great place for American Hamburgers, fries, and shakes. The fries are plentiful and really good. I’ve eaten at many Five Guys restaurants. This one is a great one. A great lunch break after an awesome tour of Sagrada. Highly recommended.
five stars for five guys! damn good burgers and fries

Really bad hilarious vegetarian option and no vegan option at all. Sandwich with a little lettuce, tomato, and grilled veggies, no sauce, no spices, no vegetarian nor vegan pattie. Really sad. The fries were fine. Never coming back
You build your own burger by selecting topping so no reason it wouldn't already be tasty but them being really good at what they do and fresh ingredients makes it magical.
It was just like being in London again, delicious burger and amazing fries. From my point of view, one large size of fries it's not enough for 4 people
Tasty burgers but quite pricey!

A menu for 12 euros and a burger at 8 euros that would be amazing ! The burger is excellent but the price can be better managed. Today it will be 10 fir the burger 3 or 4 for pataoes - no you don’t receive one kg of French fries and a drink at say 3 ! So go one time but not sure you ll repeat often !
Great burgers, fast service, clean restaurant. I will repeat.
The restaurant has a horrible atmosphere compared to most places in Barcelona but the burgers are absolutely amazing.
Bacon Milkshakes are amazing! The Burger was pretty good, too, but not the best burger of my life. At least service was quick though!
Good burger, one level up in fastfood.

My family loves visiting 5 Guys restaurants whenever we can find one. Honestly, we use them as bribery to get the kids to go see another 'pile of old stones'! 🤣Humor aside, the staff is always friendly, the food is consistent from one restaurant to the next, and so conveniently located in tourist spots where we want to visit.A taste of home for a family living abroad!

American portions. So many chips, so many burger patties, such a large milkshake. Choose two of those tops, because it's impossible you can eat all three. Did I mention the large sizes don't compromise on quality? Great stuff, great portions, and sure, you pay more than in a McDonald's next door. But trust me when I say they are not the same thing at all.
Can not compete with Five Guys in USA or Canada. Fries and buns were soggy and the staff had problems to unterstand english.
Bad burger no doubt. High prices
" Welcome to Five guys, May I take yo-"Me : Y E S
Good fries, but post-Covid extremely understaffed for even a simple order of fries
Burgers are worse than the same place in London, but better than McDonalds.
Best Burgers in Town
They (previous review writers) are right. Good burger, good fries from quality ingredients.
Worst than mc Donald’s, the burgers come only with meat and bread, no salad, pickles, tomatoes or anything. Really disappointed
Organised. Efficient. Tasty
Loved the food. A bit too expensive
Good place in centre! They serve quickly with good quality, also friendly staff who speak English as well as Spanish. It has toilets too!
burgers❤️ 😘😍
Very good food:)
Very expensive on what it offers.Very poor quality of products.Service was awful.Not recommended for anyone
Delicious hamburgers but its ...... expensive
Good burgers
Forgot my milkshake, got other milkshake order wrong, food average and way overpriced.
Finally a Five Guys near home! The food is good and there are cardboards and crayons to make doodles.
As always, big & tastyNot 5 stars because:1) the meat was slightly raw2) it is a little overpriced
Good burger!
Best Burgers in town
Very good resturent (burger house) near Sagrada familia
Nothing comparable to the normal Five Guys. Not recommended for those who know the franchise. Grieve disappointment.

Amazing foodAll fresh and in front of youRecommend for sureThe interesting thing that you can see the farm that they brought the potatoes everyday on the wallI liked the burger and firesMilkshake was smooth and tasty

Awesome Shakes, Fries and Burgers. Been to three different Five Guys in the City and always had a great experience. The Shakes were outstandingly delicious with the staff being super friendly and attentive. Thanks Five Guys!
Having a vegan milkshake option would be cool. And having a smaller size milkshake option would be great too.

Curious to try this concept, we went for lunch. Here’s 5 reasons it disappointed me. 1. It’s expensive for what it truly is which is badly presented junk food . 2. The food was served like nobody has developed ways to wrap and serve food for the last 2 centuries. 3. The burgers (cheaply wrapped) looked like the worst burger ever. The fries were thrown into the bag. Why? 4. The interior looks like it’s been designed by a 5 year old. 5. The walls are covered with self celebratory articles about how great they are. If you are truly great you don’t need to tell anyone.It tasted okay (why it has 2 stars and not 1). This is the Donald Trump of burger joints
Nothing special. Just a good burger. The fries... well they are good and you get a LOT of fries but still, the taste is average. For this price I expect more than just an average burger.
Best burgers on the planet,
Tasty!
Worst five guys I've ever been to. They just lose your order and then ignore you for half an hour. Definitely it's better to visit their competitors around.
I'm rating it 5 stars because the food was good, the staff was friendly and there was alot of food. But please add salsas for the southwestern US visitors. Thank u!😍
Fast food at not so fast food price.
The food was okay, but it's pretty slow to get served, and the ordering process is a bit confusing. A lack of wifi in such a touristy area is a bit annoying, too.

A fast food chain with a difference. Don't expect to find a 1 euro burger deal here, the prices range from 7 to 11 per burger, but one burger is more than enough! I have tried the cheeseburger and the bacon cheeseburger and highly recommend the cheeseburger. It's like they have a special cheese recipe or something!?! You have the freedom to choose your toppings and sauces and the staff are very patient and polite. It has an American diner feel throughout and free refills and peanuts on hand. It can get quite busy so check the peak times before you go! I would say it's the best cheeseburger in town!
Best burgers in town
$30, nice
Great quality!

For a fast food chain the burgers are really great, a bit pricier however you can customize your burger.The best thing, however, are the spicey fries! Go get them and start believing in God because they are holy moly the best fries ever!Also vanilla coke zero? Never seen that anywhere else
Expensive, poorly seasoned, poorly constructed burger. €15+ a fast food meal. Unacceptable.
Just like five guys back home in London! Same prices too! Not as busy as one would think considering its location! Plenty of space to sit down and eat
Amazingly juicy burgers. Fries are pretty good too

As you can imagine this is a very busy location. I only go for the fries which to be fair, are good but expensive. They are also a bit stingy on portion size. I ordered a regular fries and it is not comparable to the American sized portions. Short of going to the USA for fries, the 2nd best option is just to pay the premium for a taste of America. Pro Tip...do not waste your money on a drink...I think it is like 3.50 for a drink! Bring your own. Just grab your food and eat at the tables outside.

Five guys is great, 10 euros for a proper burger cooked to order and with a huge variety of toppings too choose from (all included in the price)Chips are cooled in peanut oil and they taste awesome.Also complementary peanuts on the house!
Wow 9 euro for the burger, 6 euro for fries. WA not worth the wait in the long line.

Right across the street from Sagrada Família, Barcelona cathedral this place was awesome. Large clean area to sit, free drink refills, fresh hot food, and the high standards of this restaurant has been maintained and enforced. The workers were always present asking to help and cleaning. Restrooms are clean and easily available to all. This manager and owner of the chain restraunt should be applauded for keeping the duplicity of the chains high standards!

Food: Burger quality is almost as good as what you may get in a good burger restaurant, and you can choose the toppings. Fries are actually really good and, without trying, their bacon looks pretty good as well. Milk shake are on the sweeter side.Environment: Well... it's an American fast food chain. Noisy, grab & go.Price: A bit above McDo but nothing crazy. It's about 9 € for a burger with double layer of beef (rather thick) and no set menu, so you can customize.
Good burgers, that is stuffed with good stuff. Good milkshakes. A lot better than their next-door neighbours McDonald's.
The burger is spectacular... but the fries are even better if you can believe that!! The cajun spice on top of them is to die for. SO glad they came to Spain!
Not that good.
Yes, it's a fast-food.Yes, it's a burger with fries.But it's so damn good!Don't forget to try the milkshake too!
Lovely little taste of America. My favorite place for burgers, hotdogs, and of course a mountain of fries.Tgey have good shakes too.....

Unseasoned meat, soggy buns, oily fries. Didn't like thinly chopped salad and onion was oily not caramelized enough. Free nuts are nice "taps" when waiting for food. Pricey for burger.

Best fries we’ve had in Spain! It would be great if they could get a decent veggie burger, though.

Very good service, great snacks, awesome soft drink machine. Fanta Frambuesa is the best, they should produce it worldwide. If I live in Barcelona someday, I will be whole weekend there. Smart! Should open franchises like this in Brazil, it'd be such success!

Very good burguer fast food chain. The vibe is sort of Americana in the 1950s. The burguers are large and tasty. The regular fries are pretty good, and the free peanuts are a great and fun idea to alleviate the waiting time.
Mm if you like fast food burgers this one is awesome, if you like "gourmet" burguers keep searching

One with classic potatoes and the other with onion rings. Very good both. You have drinks refill and such. But customer service leaves much to be desired. reviews_data.snippet: The burgers are good, but the service is not too consistent.We asked on the machine to be served at the table and, when the boy arrived, he had not brought us a glass for drinks (they are refill). It is seen that you have to ask for the glasses at the bar (where, when we went -15 August- there was only one person attending an infinite queue of people), with which in the end we had to make a little queue to request a glass that would not have It cost nothing to bring (even if it was empty) since the size and the drink were specified in the order.I found it a very inefficient system. If you put machines to expedite the issue of orders and queues, do not make us queue for something we have already asked ...It also turned out that the gas from the beverage machine was over and, upon reporting it, they changed it but did not notify anyone when they were finished, which formed another huge queue in front of the machine waiting for information ...I found it a very chaotic service, lacking in staff. The burgers are good but they are not spectacular either and the price you pay in short, there are places where you pay the same or even less and the service is much better.I do not think I'll come back.

title: Luigi Ristorante - Roger de Llúria
address: Carrer de Roger de Llúria, 50, 08009 Barcelona, Spain
description: Sleek space for pizza & Italian classics. Sophisticated dining room with an eye-catching, gold-tiled pizza oven & a traditional Italian menu.

reviews_data.snippet: An excellent dining experience - food, service, value. We showed up on a Sunday evening at about 8 pm without a reservation, and were graciously seated. Maria and all the wait staff and the host were all friendly and efficient and the food was delicious. My husband had ravioli with a very fresh tomato sauce, and I had the salmon tartare, with chunks of mango and avocado. We started with pizza bread - everything was great and we enjoyed a generous pour of wine as well. Maria gets a special mention too for her warm personality. We hope to return!

Nice place. Good service. The food was very mediocre and tasteless. All of the dishes were missing salt or sauce. The carpaccio was thick and not sliced well. The pizza wasn’t great. The pasta with salmon had no salmon.I don’t really recommend this place.
Very Tasty food and extremely nice staff. The environment inside is also well formatted. All in all a good Italian restaurant with affordable prices.

response.snippet: Thank you very much, Yarne!!! Best regards

reviews_data.snippet: Wonderful and truly Italian.Luigi delivers some truly Italian and done very well. The house marinated olives are a must have. The oil was marinated perfectly and has a great earthy taste. They are also outted so it makes it much easy to enjoy.I would recommend ordering a side of the bread with garlic and spices. Such perfect flavor and done perfectly in the pizza oven.pasta dishes again are wonderful. You will find most all of your Italian sauces paired with the proper pasta.The spritz they make is also one of the best in Barcelona. A heavy hand pour of aperol makes this drink just perfect.

reviews_data.snippet: This is ITALY! I have been to Rome and unfortunately not many Italian Restaurants served unforgettable dishes however Luigi's Ristorante in Barcelona is impressively on point. This is not a joint, it is a Restaurant, you walk in and you are greeted and led elegantly to your table (well on the way you can see those fresh pizzas getting baked to perfection) upon being seated, your eyes feast on a beautiful interior decor while you take in the overall atmosphere. Then again, you are there for the food and guess what, the food does not disappoint! We ordered the Bruschetta Pomodoro, Eggplant Parmigiana, Gnocchi alla Sorentina, Calzone and a Pizza and let me tell you it was all wiped clean. The food is absolutely delicious and the only regret was I didn't order dessert (the waiter was kind enough to offer us a complimentary piece of cake). Delicious and upscale, could be a casual lunch or a formal dinner, this place is the place to be.

response.snippet: Thanks a lot, Issam! We are moved by your words and we are very happy that you have enjoyed with us. We hope there is another chance and so you try our desserts! Best regards

Staff was nice and let me order something else - went classic with a margarita that was okay. The Dough is really good, but the rest is rather mediocre) and the cannelloni (which as per menu should be filled with chicken and beef, but it tasted and looked more like tuna. A bit confusing).I think this place is more for the vibes - having a few snacks but mostly drinks and great service. Not so much for a good dinner.

The staff was great and attentive to our needs, but the food was nothing to write home about. It might look fancy, but I felt the pizza and carbonara was quite tame. Decent beer selection, but as we also spent some time finding it, I wouldn't really recommend going here.

reviews_data.snippet: Excited to try the food, we waited 20 minutes. However, a lady was served before us, despite not having a reservation as well. She was offered a table within seconds of entering the restaurant. The waiter offered her a seat right in front of us, totally disregarding our presence. I have read similar reviews and heard experiences of others, where people of colour have been treated differently. If you are black or middle eastern and don't want your time wasted do not even bother looking at this restaurant. I am appalled and quite frankly disgusted. Once we told him we were in front, he gaslighted us and made us doubt if we wanted a table inside or outside. Furthermore, no compensation was given. We had no choice to sadly leave.

response.snippet: Hello Naima, first of all we apologize if you have been offended. But, we will write it very clear that we have no reason to treat someone differently because of race, religion, origin or whatever! Frankly, it is even a bit funny to read this, since we are a huge team, from different origins working in the company and at our tables we receive clients of all kinds, who leave happy our restaurants and do not make absurd transfers. There could have been a simple confusion, right? And so the waiter offered a table to someone who was after you. And ask if terrace or interior is what is usually done, except that the client clarifies what he wants. Anyway, there is not much more to comment ...

title: Restaurant O Retorniño
description: Galician seafood in a traditional space. Traditional venue with a bar & food counter, as well as seating for Galician-style seafood dishes.

Same with the lobster so maybe not worth upgrading the platter.Crema catalana is out of this world. Even the cheesecake beats many I had before.Barely any waiters speak English.

reviews_data.snippet: Specialty is seafood but they also have good meat.Portions are huge and prices very reasonable.Service is outstanding!!! Highly recommendedFull of local people. It gets very busy so arrive early if you don't have a reservation

The food is outstanding, big portions (think about that when you order) of juicy seafood! Sadly I have to note that when I pointed to the waiter that there were mistakes regarding the bill, he became rude. Still a great food experience, highly recommended!

Food is alright, however service is really lacking.We arrived around 8:15pm and there were only 2 to 3 tables with customers. When we walked in they asked do we have a reservation, after we told them no they pointed to a table close to the exit, right before we sat down they told us “wait” and went into a discussion while we stand there awkwardly for a good 30s+ before had us sat in the back. No explanation or anything, just “wait” and point.Later on a pair of local sat next to us after we placed our order. We both have the same waiter but you can feel the differences in service: we ordered 1 apptz and 2 entrees – they all came at different timing. The couple ordered 3 apptz and all theirs arrived before ours. We both ordered tomato bread; theirs arrive immediately, ours was forgotten. The waiter I believed checked on us once, but multiple times with the couple because we were trying to flag him down several times and he just never look at us.I understand we are Asian where they think we don’t understand Spanish. But the waiter speak totally fine English and my husband was born and raised in a Spanish speaking country! He understands 100% of what the staff talked about. I read another review mentioned they treat locals better than tourist and I totally agreed based on our experience. If we go back to Barcelona again, don’t think we will go back. :/

response.snippet: Hello Sandy, thank you for your visit & review. Receive our apologies for the inconveniences caused. In order to ensure we have tables for all our customers, we ask to our clients to make a prior reservation. When a customer arrives with no table, we try to do our best to give them a free table depending on our availability. We don't discriminate if our customers are locals or tourists, we enjoy having people from all over the world and we cannot be more happy to serve them the best food and give them the best attention.Once again, receive our apologies for the inconveniences caused. We hope you can come back and have a different experience.Thank you for your visit and for your review.Regards,Equipo O'Retorniño

reviews_data.snippet: I really had big expectations after reading the reviews but I was more than disappointed. The staff was really rude, leaving while we were speaking, throwing cutlery and dishes on the table and so on.We ordered some ‘pan con tomate’ which is the one from the picture — when we asked where are the tomatoes the lady said that this is how they are done in Catalunya...(we live here and had pan con tomate before, but anyway, this one didn’t have any tomato, not to mention it was hard and old!!)The dishes are pretty expensive, ‘patatas bravas’ are 8€ which are the most expensive ones I’ve ever seen — the problem is that they were pretty oily and bad as well!Defintely not coming back here, there are a lot of better places in Barcelona!

Excellent, unpretentious restaurant that was packed with locals when we stumbled upon it. Warm and inviting. We were greeted warmly by the owner and had excellent service throughout. The real star, however, was the food... fresh, hot, and generously served. Will gladly go back.

We ordered sea food plate and razor shell. Taste was not great as I expected. I think taste of food in its another branch, O’ Retorno 2, is much better.When order and pay the bill, please be careful. A staff changed my dishes to more expensive one(seafood plate without lobster to plate with it) and also added dishes in the bill we didnt order. Staffs were freindly but not professional.

She heard us speaking a different language and started to be really rude with us and treating us like some tourists (even though we live in Barcelona for some years)The prices were really high for the quality of the food as well. I don't recommend this place, avoid if possible!!

For a long time I wanted to go at the insistence of friends and the truth is that it has not disappointed me, the truth is that it is brutal, good service, reasonable price and extensive menu, 100% recommendedA great pleasure !!!!!!!

The best value for money, especially if you like seafood (indispensable octopus, mussels and razors). Better go there for more than 4 to try more dishes as the portions are huge. Desserts could be better (save the tiramisu).

A bustling and friendly environment where you will find a kitchen that exceeds efficiency, in the same way that the dishes exceed generosity. It is not a defect, it is a characteristic that must be taken into account when ordering. From a tomato bread executed with exquisite sensitivity, which is rare today, to an octopus as tender as a mermaid's kiss. Scallops are treated like queens. The list can go on. The service is friendly, patient, and efficient.
Excellent food, very good attention. Super recommended

title: PATRÓN
description: Seafood in a nautically themed space. Seafood restaurant styled like a boat, with dishes like king crab & ceviche, plus live music.

reviews_data.snippet: Great attention, little portion considering the price, tasty enough but not spectacular

This restaurant is fantastic and really worth a visit. The menu of the day has around 5 choices of each dish (start, mainz dessert), comes with a drink and costs roughly €15 l. Great value. Moreover, the food is great.The staff are polite, friendly and approachable and the atmosphere is nice and laid back. I would recommend it to anyone who is nearby around lunchtime.
The place is super nice. The servers were nice too but too around 45 minutes to bring the food. This was at noon and we asked what was on the menu that day. Really bad
I was actually expecting more of the food offered. Especially, the second plate of the €35 menu. Service was excellent. Katya was very attentive and professional.
The foods, the services, the ambiences..all great

Absolutely mediocre. Very low coefficient quality-price.The squid paella was totally burnt and had more sausages than squid.The king crab burger was disappointing, too. The bun was not fresh, the “king” crab patty was made out of frozen crabs and the sauce was from a tube.Overall, the food was edible and the stuff was nice, but with those prices you would expect something special. Drinks were expensive, too.110 euros / 3 pers to eat cantine food and drink a basic long drink. Do not recommend

I rarely post but when it is necessary. I booked to go to Patron with my friends who came to visit me from the Caribbean. Arrives in front of the restaurant, the 3 security guard that i have a reservation. He starts to stutter, looks at his friend and tells me that its not possible because my friends are « badly dressed ». Im a little shocked, i explained to him that indeed if they are going to change (they had sneackers anyway which have their prices) could that be possible? There, he doesnt answer me and tells me that he could recommend another restaurant. I swear, while he’s telling me this, a bunch of boys in ripped jeans and sneackers fit in with no problem. We understand that at Patron, you enter if you have a good head, and i am sorry to say but they are litterally racist. I never had a problem getting back to the Patron, and it never happened to us..... im shocked i was ashamed that this happened to my loved ones, its disrespectful, its horrible and i hope that other people will not have to undergo. We know very well that whatever we may have done, they will have refused our entry, Its only a restaurant, not a club, how dare hou refuse an entry? I just want to add to the owner that the dress doesnt make the monk, and unfortunately for him we payed an astronomical sum in a restaurant which worth it.

This place was very nice. The server was attentive and the bar tender gave generous pours for the 'old fashioned' cocktails. The food was excellent as well as the live music. I would recommend getting a reservation
Great atmosphere, lovely seating areas, caters allsort of Seafood tasted many sushi dishes, starters and desserts all freshly made and mouthwatering. 5 star service by all staff and friendly too.

What an absolute waste of the owner's money invest so much on the appearance of the location to throw it all in the trash can with their horrendous service.Aside from the fact that they couldn't serve mixed drinks due to NOT HAVING A CAPABLE BARTENDER???, the servers were so incredibly bad that one just walked away mid-order and the other brought an entire bottle of wine when we asked for the check (amongst other things). Frankly would've been better off staying home and saved my money with a mid-tier bottle of wine and my 3 friends than spent what we did for this lousy service.

Amazing food and incredible service! The wife and I enjoyed the dinner. Worth every penny. Service is the best I received in a restaurant so far. The staff who served us made sure we are having a good time. Ambiance of the place is really good too! Definitely will visit the place again if ever we come back to Barcelona. Two thumbs up! 👍👍👌

Amazing high-level restaurant. Has very interesting design, what's reminding deck of a boat. Staff is very nice and friendly. We got a welcome vodka from manager, in cause we are Russians.You can be very lucky to catch the live-music concert during the week too!

One of my friends went and recommend to me. So we went and tried it out. Unfortunately they changed the menu so we could not try the dish my friend recommendedWe liked shrimp with garlic and the sauces of the clams. The paella has strong flavour.I recommend this restaurant to my friends highly !

I have gone to this restaurant for dinner while in Barcelona. Beautiful ambiance in addition to terrific food choices, fun cocktails, and good wine list.Dennis was helping with food selections and explained local meal choices and traditions in the process.
Excellent it will be pleasure to return to baçalona only for this best restaurant

Nice place for tapas. Went in the evening with my young teens. Music was a bit loud, although the atmosphere is nice. Waiters are friendly and helpful. Tapas dishes were nice although i ordered a main too. Good main portion if you are having drinks also. Dessert was lovely, red velvet cake slice.

A cosy restaurant, with plenty of seatings and live music, that turns into a bar with DJ music on a Friday evening.Great tapas menu, everything was very tasty. The Octopus (Pulpo a la brasa) was a bit overcooked.Good selection of wine and enough selection by the glass to choose from.Serviceminded and friendly staff, Spanish prefered.Great portion of the dessert, also petit four served at the end.
Amazing place. Food is great, environment is cozy and stylish, service is very, very good. Will return again.
Food quality is good.I especially love the grilled fish, octopus and tuna tartare€700 was miskenedly charged. Bill checking is advised

Everything was delicious, attentive service. Due to language barrier “ordered” toast and tomato and olive tapenade appetizer for 4 by mistake, that’s the reason for 4 stars only, so an extra €10. It was tasty though.
High end restaurant with amazing cuisine and exceptional service.
Amazing
Very nice boat-styled restaurant close to the Barcelona train station. Great fish food, paella and meat. Enjoyed our stay here.
Amazing tapas! Great music and atmosphere
We celebrated our wedding anniversary here, and had a lovely dinner. Staff are nice, food is great. Highly recommended!
We, group of 5, made reservations 5 days in advance and when we arrive they seat us in the bar, in the farthest corner of the restaurant! We will not return any time soon.

We had the gran mariscada or something. Which was a big plate full with seafood. It was good but somehow we regret we didnt chose for some other dishes which looked much better. The deserts were delicious! Bit pricey though...

Excellent ambience, service and food. Prices are average, not exactly cheap. The paellas are amazing. I've enjoyed my mojitos and my wife her Pina Coladas, served in big glasses (€8 but well worth it). We've asked for about 4 different tapas and 1 paella, plus drinks and it was about €60. They don't charge service, but we were happy to leave tips for the excellent service. They're open until late, but kitchen might close an hour prior to last hour, so bear it in mind.
Great atmosphere and delicious food!
Great menu and personal. We loved it!
Very tasty sea food. Nice live music
Staff was very responsive and they speak english very well.... about the food: 10 stars..... live music, perfect place for diner....:)))
A very nice restaurant, with excellent service.We ordered a few fish tapas and a great paella 👌.Big thanks to Edoardo that serves our table and was incredibly nice and attentive.
Nice place and good waiters.
Excellent food, atmosphere and service

Not bad restaurant and place but beware if you pay by card they will overcharge you with the excuse there is a bad connection inside ....but if you claim tour money back obviously won't get it....good luck !
Amazing place! Delicious food! Good atmosphere! Highly recommend!
You can't imagine the decoration inside by looking at outside. It is a big restaurant inside and decorated lIke a cabin.
Loved the ambience at Patron. We went for a class meet and thoroughly enjoyed the food and drinks. For the vegetarians, they have a very tasty burger
Very good
Great food and friendly service.
Delicious food, reasonable price, great environment with friendly, attentive staffs. Definitely recommend.

Don’t really like it cuz it’s not that good. The dishes are too small and it’s too pricey.We ordered a dish of shrimp and the amount is too little that can barely cover the plate. And the octopus tastes like it was over boiled.The only good thing is that the environment is nice but considering its food, it’s not a good choice of eating here.
Authentic place with good service.
Great ambience perfect for date or group dining experience

Nice fish restaurant, where you can have good fish even on Mondays. They serve early dinner. Good for all North- Europeans ;-)My fish soup was very good, the sea bass fresh and tasty. The side dish a bit to oily. Therefore the chocolate dessert melted on my tongue.The waiters are professional, what I really appreciate!We will see us again
Fantastic, great food, attentive service and live music
